column4: is there a way to record and play back keyboard and mouse events?
I want to make a screencast, but what I want to do is go through the motions/actions, take however long it takes me
and then replay back those actions but all at a smooth consistent pace so people don't have to sit there and watch a motionless screen because I was thinking
sounds like you need to plan your screencast before you start recording it :)
no I have it planned out
but for example, if I have code snippets, instead of typing them out myself, why not just echo snippet | myTypingProgram
I might have a solution for the keyboard problem, but can't think of one for the mouse.
so then people don't have to watch me backspace and correct typos for example
hmm ... a history enabled clipboard might solve that part.
ok, how do I get such a thing?
you'd have to search for one and install it - or use an editor that can store snippets with keyboard hotkeys.
it's not about storing the snippets, it's about having them appear as if they were typed out at a consistent e.g. 50wpm or so
aaah okay, I understand your question now. You want the *appearance* of characters being typed even if you say - copy paste a snippet.

and e.g. if I move my mouse from x,y to x+100,y+100 I would much rather have it just transition smoothely from point A to point B and ignore any of the jigger that my mousing hand might have introduced
just want to make things as smooth and seamless as possible
I supposed I just might have to write something like this myself
I'm sorry I don't know of a way to do this, its a good idea though.
